thread.title: SmartLab International Sponsors Major Blockchain Event in Malaysia - citybuzz
thread.title_full: SmartLab International Sponsors Major Blockchain Event in Malaysia - citybuzz

author: NewsRamp.com
title: SmartLab International Sponsors Major Blockchain Event in Malaysia - citybuzz
text: SmartLab International, a company specializing in artificial intelligence (AI) applications for market-spread trading, has made a significant move in the blockchain space by sponsoring the Web3Dev Global Track event in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. The company joined forces with other notable sponsors, including the Solana Foundation and InvestHK, a department of the Hong Kong Government responsible for Foreign Direct Investment. The Web3Dev Global Track event served as a crucial platform for developers and blockchain enthusiasts from around the world to connect, network, and explore the latest trends in Web3 technology. With over 60 speakers in attendance, the event covered a wide range of topics, including AI+DePin, DeFi, GameFi, SocialFi, Real World Assets (RWA), PropTech, Alt-coins, Memecoins, and Layer 1 & Layer 2 solutions. Participants had the opportunity to engage in hands-on coding sessions and workshops, providing practical experience and insights into the rapidly evolving blockchain landscape. The event facilitated meaningful interactions and knowledge sharing, empowering attendees to explore new ideas and solutions that could potentially drive the industry forward. Alex Wu, CEO of SmartLab International, emphasized the importance of the company’s sponsorship, stating, ‘As a relatively new player in the blockchain and crypto space, SmartLab International, through sponsorship of this event, hopes to build greater brand-name awareness while also reinforcing our commitment to fostering innovation and collaboration within the blockchain ecosystem.’ Wu further expressed the company’s aspirations, saying, ‘SmartLab International hopes that through sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track Event, we can contribute to the growth of Web3 technology, and this event showcased the immense potential of our efforts.’ The success of the Web3Dev Global Track event underscores the growing significance of Web3 technologies and the need for continued dialogue among industry leaders. As blockchain technology continues to evolve and find new applications across various sectors, events like these play a crucial role in shaping the future of the industry. SmartLab International’s participation in this event marks a strategic move for the company, as it seeks to establish itself as a key player in the blockchain and cryptocurrency space. By aligning itself with other prominent organizations and supporting developer-focused initiatives, SmartLab International demonstrates its commitment to driving innovation and fostering collaboration within the ecosystem. The sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track event also highlights the increasing interest of AI-focused companies in blockchain technology. As the intersection between AI and blockchain continues to grow, events like these provide valuable opportunities for cross-pollination of ideas and the development of new, innovative solutions. For the broader blockchain and cryptocurrency industry, the success of events like the Web3Dev Global Track signals a maturing ecosystem that is attracting attention from diverse sectors. The involvement of government entities, such as InvestHK, alongside private companies and foundations, demonstrates the growing recognition of blockchain’s potential impact on various industries and economies. As the Web3 landscape continues to evolve, events that bring together developers, industry experts, and enthusiasts will play an increasingly important role in shaping the future of the technology. SmartLab International’s sponsorship of the Web3Dev Global Track event not only positions the company as a forward-thinking player in the space but also contributes to the overall growth and development of the blockchain ecosystem. For more information about SmartLab International and its initiatives, interested parties can visit the company’s [website](https://smartlab.international/index.html). This news story relied on a press release distributed by [BlockchainWire](https://blockchainwire.io).
